message.content:
cs.NI, cs.IT, cs.MM, cs.SY, cs.CR

Reasoning: 
1. cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) - The paper proposes a Radio Resource Management (RRM) algorithm to optimize point-to-multipoint transmissions in HSPA networks. This involves managing network resources and optimizing the transmission of data, which falls under the scope of networking and internet architecture.
2. cs.IT (Information Theory) - The paper discusses the selection of proper modulation and coding schemes on the downlink, which is a key aspect of information theory.
3. cs.MM (Multimedia) - The paper focuses on improving the performance of Multimedia Broadcast Multicast Services (MBMS) in HSPA networks, which falls under the scope of multimedia.
4. cs.SY (Systems and Control) - The proposed RRM algorithm involves optimizing the system capacity and service quality, which falls under the scope of systems and control.
5. cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) - Although the paper does not explicitly discuss security, the optimization of point-to-multipoint transmissions in HSPA networks may have implications for security, making this category a possibility.
